info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 17 at 5:45AM CDT until August 17 at 6:15AM CDT by NWS Chicago IL
info.description:
At 545 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated that the heaviest rain has ended across the warned area, likely allowing for some improvement. However, radar automated rain gauges indicate that between 3 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. Due to runoff from the intense rainfall overnight, flash flooding is likely ongoing across the warned area. The expected additional rainfall rate is 0.5 inches in 30 minutes from scattered thunderstorms moving into the warned area.
HAZARD...Flash flooding.
SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges.
IMPACT...Rapid-onset flooding of creeks, streams, drainage ditches, streets, underpasses, low-lying areas, and other poor drainage areas.
Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Aurora, Joliet, far southwest Naperville, Bolingbrook, Romeoville, Plainfield, Oswego, Lockport, Yorkville, Crest Hill, Montgomery, Shorewood, Sugar Grove, Boulder Hill, Fairmont, Rockdale, Crystal Lawns and Bristol.
info.instruction:
A Flash Flood Warning means rapid-onset flooding is imminent or already occurring. Persons along creeks, drainage ditches, and other waterways should take immediate precautions to protect life and property.
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 AM CDT THIS MORNING FOR SOUTH CENTRAL KANE, NORTHEASTERN KENDALL AND WEST CENTRAL WILL COUNTIES

area.areaDesc: Kane, IL; Kendall, IL; Will, IL
